text:
Kottanad is a village in Pathanamthitta district, Kerala, India.
Religion.
Kottanad's major religions are Hinduism, Christianity, and Islam.
Climate.
Like the other parts of the state, Kottanad has a wet and maritime tropical climate. The region receives most of the rain from the South-West monsoon and the North-East monsoon. Summer is from March to May. During these times the place receives locally developed thundershowers. Due to the higher elevation, the climate is cooler towards the eastern area.
Economy.
The economy of Kottanad is mainly from agriculture. Kottanad is one of the rubber producing villages in Kerala. Other major crops are coconut, tapioca and pepper.
Transport.
The major mean of transportation of people in Kottanad is public transportation system, KSRTC as well as private bus services.
Administration.
Kottanad Village is a part of Pathanamthitta district administration. The Kottanad village office is in Perumpetty.
